## Day 1: Introduction to R/RStudio

| Time          | Session                                                                 |
|---------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 10:00 - 11:00 | Introduction to Data Science for Transport Planning                     |
| 11:00 - 12:30 | Finding, importing and cleaning transport datasets<br>- Origin-destination datasets<br>- OpenStreetMap (OSM) and Ordnance Survey (OS) OpenRoads datasets<br>- Stats19 road safety data |
| 12:30 - 13:30 | Lunch                                                                  |
| 13:30 - 15:00 | Origin-destination data analysis                                        |
| 15:00 - 15:15 | Break and refreshments                                                 |
| 15:15 - 17:00 | Routing and route network analysis<br>- Setting up an interface to a routing engine and using it to calculate routes and distances using GTFS data |

## Day 2

| Time          | Session                                                                 |
|---------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 09:00 - 10:45 | Spatio-temporal data<br>- Demonstration of open-access OD data with hourly resolution<br>- Demonstration with stats19 data for road safety analysis |
| 10:45 - 11:15 | Break and refreshments                                                 |
| 11:15 - 12:30 | OD Transport data visualisation                                        |
| 12:30 - 13:30 | Lunch                                                                  |
| 13:30 - 15:00 | Best practices for data science in transport planning<br>- Version control with Git and GitHub<br>- Reproducible research with Quarto |
